page.title: 01BELLINGHAM COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: The area stretches from the edge of {Bellingham}village to the hamlet of {Redesmouth}about two miles away and from the{River Tyne}to moorland in the north. The land around is mostly{farmland with large stretches of rough grazing and{moorland.}The outer section of the village contains some the oldest and the newest housing,and of course the first and middle schools also used as a centre for adult and youth recreational activities. Running through the section is the {old railway}line a former link to the outside world.Although now well served with minor roads the severe winters can leave the village cut off from its neighbours.A pleasant quiet{rural {location}appealing to many people for {holidays,retirement}or{country living.
